Hi I have got the explorer running, but all the fields are like: '{{ size - $index -1 }} ', they haven't been parsed by the templating engine I'm guessing. The command line is showing accurate data though
Hi guys just a small query. Is it possible to query based on timestamp or block number and retrieve the old block key value? I had read in a documentation that it is a work in progress.
AFAIK you can currently query using block number
<@U0YNFB22X>  Can you send me the API for that? Or any guide on how to do the same
<@U2R9NU4NQ> See <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/API/CoreAPI/#rest-api> for the whole REST API. The resource you care about is /chain/blocks/{Block}
Blockchain explorer provides that functionality now
You can input a block number and it returns block info

<@U296PJDD1>  /chain/blocks/{Block} returns only metadata info about the block like the transactions, block, and timestamp? Say I have saved "Good morning" in the key "Hello" later I had used invoke method to change the value of "Hello" to "Good night". If I query with "Hello" it will return as "Good night" (which is the latest value). I am interested on knowing how to retrieve "Good morning" if I pass "Hello". 
Hope I did not confuse you
My understanding is that is something you need to implement in your smart contract. You need to implement saving the history

Hi, Please let me know if this forum provides solutions regarding "hyperledger v0.6" related queries. Thanks.
In fabric, what constitute a block?
is it just one transaction or more than one?

<@U3AS9E53J> There are one or more transactions per block.  This is a function of two parameters that specify the maximum number of transactions per block, or a timeout, at which time the block will be written regardless of how many transactions are in it.  E.g. for fabric v0.6  check out *consensus/noops/config.yaml* or *consensus/noops/config.yaml*.

hi, I am trying to explore blockchain  and hyperledger  in my ubuntu machine i could not get that when i follow the commands specified in the git hub hyperledger page.. can anyone tried before please help me. thanks.
i may getting this log when i explore blockchain explorer "INFO 030 Initializing the REST service on 0.0.0.0:7050, TLS is disabled"
whether i have done exploring the blockchain? i could not find any running services related to blockchain !!!
can any one experienced blockchain explorer via ubuntu, docker platform?? please let me know the clear procedure!!

<@U3N0GM3S7> , The explorer does not work with latest version of hyperledger. It was designed for version 0.6. We are in the process of redesigning the explorer for 1.0. Commit level I tested is 987ff84 with vagrant on Windows. It will work on docker too. Are you trying with docker images for 1.0 ? Make sure the REST port is opened for the explorer to access. Follow instructions in README.md in the explorer repo.
<@U12J2D15H> , I am using hyperledger version 0.6 only. Trying with docker images.
Can you give me the git link which you stated above? Just I want to experience the blockchain-explorer with hyperledger version 0.6. using docker images. Thanks,

<@U3N0GM3S7>  The version of blockchain-explorer that works with Fabric v0.6 is at <https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer> .  Do a *git clone <https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer> * and then follow the directions in *blockchain-explorer/explorer_1/README.md*.   

I followed the instructions in the Installation section and only had to make one deviation from them-  I was installing as root,  and *bower* did not like being installed as root until I performed this command:  ```echo '{ "allow_root": true }' > /root/.bowerrc``` as specified here:  <http://serverfault.com/questions/548537/cant-get-bower-working-bower-esudo-cannot-be-run-with-sudo> 

*Note:* I just ran the explorer natively on my OS and not in a Docker container so I didn't do the last step of building the hyperledger/blockchain-explorer Docker image, so I don't know if there are any pitfalls in that step.
